intro: Pelargonium pilipes, commonly known as the pink geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant features lobed leaves with a hairy texture and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions. Pelargonium pilipes is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
